snippet: The University of Leicester had laid plans for Richard’s re-internment based on a government license, but champions of York argued that the city was the king’s preferred burial place.
abstract: British cities Leicester and York are battling in court to acquire remains of King Richard III, which were found beneath a municipal parking lot in 2012; University of Leicester had laid plans for Richard’s re-internment based on a government license, but champions of York argue that the city is the king’s preferred burial place.
lead_paragraph: The University of Leicester had laid plans for Richard’s re-internment based on a government license, but champions of York argued that the city was the king’s preferred burial place.

headline.main: Two English Cities Battle in Court to Acquire Remains of King Richard III
headline.print_headline: Two English Cities Battle in Court to Acquire Remains of King Richard III
